intro: Melochia sericea, commonly known as silky melochia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along riverbanks. Its fibrous roots and adaptability make it a hardy species in various climates.
